blog.name: brainlicking
blog.title: art blog whoo!
blog.description:
G'day, this is the art blog of S Rosengaard. I am a graphic novelist who is in the process of creating my first story. 

Contained within will be copious amounts of content featuring my original characters, and less copious amounts of fanart. 
FAIR WARNING, gore and body horror art are unflinchingly posted here.


(I don’t take requests, but if you inbox something interesting, I may (or may not) draw it during my free time.)

tags: I MIGHT draw my interpretation of their human-shaped bodies
I had fun colouring this hahaa
summary: I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens!  Firstly for Crowley I...
caption:
I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens! 

Firstly for Crowley I wanted to give him multiple eyes as a remained of the times where he used to be an angel, and of course horns for his current demon status.

For Aziraphale, since he’s the guardian of the eastern gate, I wanted to give him a dawn-like colour palette and starry skin, as the sun rises in the east.

(open picture in new tab to get in the details)

✧ tip jar ✧ RedBubble ✧  Etsy ✧

blog.name: they-handed-me-the-moon
blog.title: They Handed Me The Moon
blog.description: Paige, 23, she/her, queer. This blog is for whatever catches my interest, which for now is primarily Good Omens

tags: he still ends up facing the truth EVENTUALLY
and until then tends to sort of drift aimlessly in its direction
but if he doesn't want to see it he drags his heals real hard
summary: As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that...
body:
As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that he is very bad at thoroughgoing self-deception, (he always asks the right questions in spite of himself), but he is so good at alternate explanations and caveats that he is able to hold himself at arm’s length from uncomfortable truths.

And part of that genuinely is him avoiding things he doesn’t want to face, but part of it is an endless low-key anxiety spiral that results in his overanalyzing every possible option and being terrified of making the wrong choice.

For example, I vacillate on whether “sauntered vaguely downward” is a reliable description of Crowley’s fall because the narration throughout Good Omens tends to minimize the trauma of his experiences, but it does make sense for the Crowley I imagine. Because hell is right to say something is wrong with heaven, and Crowley knows it, but that Satan fellow seems like a right bonehead, and does he really want to get himself involved in this mess? So he never truly takes a stance with hell, neither quite faces the ugliness of either option, but when the lines are drawn he just sort of finds himself a bit more on the side of hell, without ever having admitted to himself that he’d made up his mind.

Similarly, when he meets Aziraphale he sort of knows right away that he likes this angel and wants to spend time with him, but for all he knows this is heaven playing a trick on him, or just a bit of lingering nostalgia for his old life, and anyhow Aziraphale made it clear that he is on the side of Good and believes that Crowley can only be Bad, so that’s that. But they keep spending time with one another regardless, and Crowley is sort of aware that he’s doing it on purpose, that he likes doing it, but whenever he comes close to really admitting the significance of that he spirals into a million excuses and alternatives. Then one day it hits him that they’re proper friends, have been for ages, and that he cares for Aziraphale. And that’s terrifying on any number of levels, he’d never have made up his mind to put himself in such a position, but then he went and did it anyway while he was distracting himself with excuses.

Basically, whereas Aziraphale has one foolproof explanation (ineffability) that keeps him from facing uncomfortable truths, Crowley does see the uncomfortable truth and buries it beneath every alternate explanation under and over the sun. 

And then eventually the truth becomes too glaring to ignore so he just throws hands and goes the fuck to sleep.

tags: remember kids: always be critical of someones work but never forget that the intention is good and we need all the representation we can get
summary: (1/2) about the queerbait or not: I think we should all remeber that fans asked Neil Gaiman this questions for years. The whole...
question: (1/2) about the queerbait or not: I think we should all remeber that fans asked Neil Gaiman this questions for years. The whole "are they a couple, aren't they? What was your intention while writing their relationship". I think even with the relationship staying similar to the one in the book, the whole fan discussions and discussions with the fan has probably sensibilized him for queer subtext, text, queerbaiting and lgbtq representation. So i hope he knows what he is doing.
answer:
“(2/2) but we also need to take in mind, and this is where the whole concern comes from imo, that many shows who allways told us how well they understand the relationship their main characters have with eachother fucked up really hard in the end. So i can understand that the fandom is careful”

i couldn’t have said it better. i absolutely agree

reblog.comment:

tags: and its nearly four in the morning
summary:
Something I absolutely adore about Aziraphale and Crowley is how universally relatable they are.
They're very distinct...
body:
Something I absolutely adore about Aziraphale and Crowley is how universally relatable they are.

They’re very distinct characters, but people read so much of themselves into them and their relationship, whether you see it as a QPR or romantic or platonic or an Unfortunate Mutual Pining Situation (lmao), or something that we might not have adequate words for yet.

They’re very human in personality, and I think people really connect with their anxiety, curiosity, love, and bravery, and their eventual acceptance of each other as flawed people who have repeated the same mistakes over and over.

Something about these characters just makes people go “oh! That’s me!” and go wild with projecting headcanons onto them, and I love how such a variety of people with a variety of experiences can feel about these characters so deeply.

tags: GIVE ME MY STUPID GAYS HOLDING HANDS FACING SATAN
summary:
the use of Under Pressure in the new Good Omens trailer has me SHOOK
The whole “It was nice knowing you” “We can’t give up now”...
body:
the use of Under Pressure in the new Good Omens trailer has me SHOOK

The whole “It was nice knowing you” “We can’t give up now” underlaid by the “caring about ourselves, this is our last dance” was uhhh A Choice that fed my shipping soul

But I’m SALTED why are they not holding each other’s hands, I love that they’re holding Adams don’t get me wrong but gIVE ME MY GAYS HOLDING HANDS DAMMIT

body:
Crowley: Angel, I can’t wait until we’re married.
Aziraphal: Dear, we’re not even engaged?
Crowley: THAT’S WHAT I FORGOT TO DO LAST NIGHT.

dialogue.name: Crowley
dialogue.label: Crowley:
dialogue.phrase: Angel, I can’t wait until we’re married.

blog.title: Fellas? Is it Harold?
blog.description:
Katherine, 22 lesbian she/her UK
Good Omens, Star Trek and any other hyperfixations

summary: I didn't believe morangate would ever become relevant again but honestly when will white cishet women work out that joking...
body: I didn’t believe morangate would ever become relevant again but honestly when will white cishet women work out that joking around about queerbait and slash fic isn’t at all progressive and maybe we should just write and celebrate actual gay relationships in media rather than all jerk off to the “homoerotic undertones” and then shit on the fans who actually take it a bit more seriously than a fetish omg here we go again

summary: Weird request but help a gal out. I'm trying to read Good Omens before the show comes out and I'm about half way through. I'm...
body: Weird request but help a gal out. I’m trying to read Good Omens before the show comes out and I’m about half way through. I’m really loving it but I’m almost too scared to read it as I care too much what happens. I’m tempted to go on wiki and spoil myself just so I can mentally prepare but basically can someone just tell me with a basic yes or no nothing else I don’t want to be spoiled if it has a happy ending or not? Bc I’m getting super anxious and way too attached to Crowley and Aziraphale and Adam etc like I imagine it’s not a clear cut ending considering were dealing with the fabric of existence itself but I just wanna know if I’ll cry okay someone pls help
